cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and head toward the north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, northern & southern coasts of Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, SE Bahamas and Turks & Caicos (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles (Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Cuba) and later the U.S. north-central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds reaching PortMiami late Monday into Tuesday; most likely breezy conditions rather than damaging winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for PortMiami given the offshore track and weak wind field over South Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only fringe showers possible; heavy rainfall focus remains over Cuba and the Bahamas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional higher seas and swells may enter the Florida Straits Monday, creating rougher pilot-boat and container-vessel approaches.
